intro: Tarenna eketensis var. auricluna, commonly known as the golden ear plant, is a flowering shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features elliptical, glossy leaves with a slightly waxy texture, and its stems are often covered in fine, short hairs. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
